page.title: 18AMBERLEY REVELS
page.content: The Amberley Revels and Flower Show was established in thw early 1920's as the May Revels. The present day event also features the crowning of the May Queen. The fete always starts with a procession through the village to the cricket field. This year the May Queen, Donna Bartlett travelled with her 3 attendents in an open top Mercedes. Following in an vintage Southdown Bus were the children entering the fancy dress. There were side shows and stalls. The Flower Show had enteries for vegetables, flowers, plants, cookery, needlework, painting and photography. As part of the celebrations a Disco was held at the Black Horse on Friday, and on Saturday there was a Barn Dance and Barbecue at the cricket field. There is always an over 70's tea party as well.
